children.name: K-PS2-1
children.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to compare the effects of different strengths or different directions of pushes and pulls on the motion of an object.

children.name: K-PS3-1
children.description: Make observations to determine the effect of sunlight on Earth’s surface.

children.name: Organization for Matter & Energy Flow in Organisms
K-LS1-1
children.description: Use observations to describe patterns of what plants and animals (including humans) need to survive.

children.name: K-ESS2-1
children.description: Use and share observations of local weather conditions to describe patterns over time.

children.name: K-ESS2-2
children.description: Construct an argument supported by evidence for how plants and animals (including humans) can change the environment to meet their needs.

children.name: K-ESS3-1
children.description: Use a model to represent the relationship between the needs of different plants and animals (including humans) and the places they live.

children.name: K-ESS3-2
children.description: Ask questions to obtain information about the purpose of weather forecasting to prepare for, and respond to, severe weather.

children.name: K-ESS3-3
children.description: Communicate solutions that will reduce the impact of humans on the land, water, air, and/or other living things in the local environment.

children.name: K-2-ETS1-1
children.description: Ask questions, make observations, and gather information about a situation people want to change to define a simple problem that can be solved through the development of a new or improved object or tool.

children.name: K-2-ETS1-2
children.description: Develop a simple sketch, drawing, or physical model to illustrate how the shape of an object helps it function as needed to solve a given problem.

children.name: K-2-ETS1-3
children.description: Analyze data from tests of two objects designed to solve the same problem to compare the strengths and weaknesses of how each performs.
